Description: Beef and buffalo meat produced annually, in kilograms per person
Beef and buffalo meat consumed annually, in kilograms per person.
Percentage of important sites covered by protected areas, marine
Percentage of important sites covered by protected areas, terrestrial
Percentage of important sites covered by protected areas, freshwater

Change in Water Use Efficiency (WUE), 2018 compared with 2010-2015 average: WUE is the value added of a given major sector divided by the volume of water used. WUE at the national level is the sum of the efficiencies in the major economic sectors weighted according to the proportion of water withdrawn by each sector over the total withdrawals

Level of Water Stress: Freshwater withdrawal as a proportion of available freshwater resources is the ratio between total freshwater withdrawal by major economic sectors and total renewable freshwater resources, after taking into account environmental water requirements. This indicator is also known as water withdrawal intensity
Percentage of total final energy consumption generated from “renewable sources” (RS, collected from World Bank; includes hydroelectric, geothermal, solar, tidal, wind, and biofuels)
Percentage of total final energy consumption generated from biofuels
Average fuel price. The pump prices of the most widely sold grade of gasoline. Prices are in USD per liter.
CO2 emissions from transport in tonnes per inhabitant, tonnes referring to thousands of kilograms
If the child labor rate is statistically nonzero, a country scores between 0.00 and 0.50 based on their level of child labor.
If the child labor rate in a country is statistically indistinguishable from zero, a country scores between 0.50 and 1.00 based on years of compulsory education.
Percentage of individuals over the age of 66+ living in relative income poverty
Expected years in retirement, men
Expected years in retirement, women
Score of the world’s most important tax havens, rated by how aggressively and extensively each jurisdiction helps multinationals evade taxes.

Score based on 20 measures of financial secrecy, grouped around ownership registration, legal entity transparency, integrity of tax and financial regulation, and international standards and cooperation.

Intermediate: Domestic Credit in the Private Sector
Description: The financial resources provided to the private sector by financial corporations as a percentage of GDP.
Deposited money in banks and other financial institutions as a percentage of GDP.
The percentage of the population with access to electricity
Executive opinion survey responses to the question: “In your country, how would you assess the reliability of the electricity supply?
Percentage of households with internet access
Fixed broadband download speed in Mbps.
The natural log of rail lines per square kilometer (millions) per capita (millions)
The natural log of roadways per square kilometer per capita.
Percentage of women in the national parliament.
Women have equal access to passports, foreign travel, domestic travel, and housing (4 Q’s, each worth 0.25 for yes, 0 for no).
Women protected by law from domestic violence and subservience; have equal access to divorce and remarriage. (5Qs, worth 0.2 for yes, 0 for no).
Women have equal access to credit, inheritance, pensions, and retirement. Combines two measurements made up of 7 questions.

Proportion of GDP spent on higher education R&D
Number of researchers per 1 million people, data weight of 50%.
Total Good Foreign Aid as Percentage of GDP
Total Good Foreign Aid per Capita reflects the extent to which recipients solicit foreign aid for their population.
